title: Developer
description: I started working at Talan Labs as a developer after my graduation in 2018. I had a strong interest in Blockchain technologies getting out of university and I saw an opportunity there. During my time at Talan Labs I haven't just practiced my Blockchain development skills, I also developed my soft skills and had a complete experience as a front-end developer.

detail.title: Blockchain
tasks: During 5 months I helped mentoring a team of 5 engineering students on a Blockchain project we called Share2Gether: a platform for organizing events with a reputation system to avoid no-show.
In parallel I created a lecture and a practical training on the main concepts of Hyperledger Fabric.
I held lectures on Ethereum and Hyperledger Fabric at my former Engineering School to the graduate students and supervised practical work on Ethereum (Solidity) development
I worked on the evolution of two similar apps: TalanCoin and VCoin, both decentralized coins that allow for more cooperation between co-workers.

detail.title: React
tasks: I worked at CACIB (Cr√©dit Agricole Corporate and Investment Banking) in an agile team developing an interface that displays market data and allows users to verify and validate those data.

title: Research Assistant
description: I did my final internship at the headquarters of Volkswagen in Germany in their Research & Development campus, in the Autonomous Driving department.

detail.title: Autonomous Driving
tasks: I developed a C++ module to estimate the intentions of crossing the road of pedestrians, using a machine learning graphical model (Markov Logic Network).

title: Software Engineering Intern
description: Voice Recognition: rendering the capabilities of an audio routing platform, enabling testing of speech providers

detail.title: Web
tasks: Implementing a web interface to record and send audio data to various speech providers in order to compare their performances.
